properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 11 at 10:10AM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Mississippi...

Pearl River At Jackson affecting Hinds and Rankin Counties

The Flood Warning continues for
The Pearl River At Jackson
* from this morning until further notice.
* At  9:30 AM Tuesday the stage was 28.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 28.0 feet.
* Forecast...Heavy rainfall from 5 to 6 inches has fallen across
the north and central Pearl River Basin. The crest forecast has
been raised. The river will continue rising to near 35.5 feet
by Saturday morning.
* Impact...At 35.4 feet...Water approaches homes in the Hightower
Area.
* Impact...At 35.0 feet...Some businesses are affected near Town
Creek. River waters will flood some of the streets of Northeast
Jackson subdivisions which are close to the river and a number of
additional streets in downtown Jackson.
* Impact...At 34.0 feet...Dozens of additional streets flood in
downtown Jackson.
* Impact...At 33.0 feet...Rosemary Road is closed. Sidney Street is
impassable. There is water on West Street. The playing field off
Westbrook Road is underwater. Water is on Nichols and Julienne
streets in the Hightower Area; however, both are passable. Water is
approaching packs auto detail shop on South West Street.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 24 hours.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.
